snippet: A nonprofit group is shepherding five eco-playgrounds into schools in Queens and Brooklyn to teach children about water and urban infrastructure.
abstract: Nonprofit group the Trust for Public Land is overseeing construction of five eco-playgrounds in schools in Brooklyn and Queens; schools are chosen in part due to their proximity to overtaxed wastewater-treament plants; project is designed to help clean up New York City's waterways and to teach children about water and urban infrastructure.
lead_paragraph: A nonprofit group is shepherding five eco-playgrounds into schools in Queens and Brooklyn to teach children about water and urban infrastructure.

headline.seo: Queens Students Get Water Lessons by Designing Playground
headline.main: Getting Lessons on Water by Designing a Playground
headline.print_headline: Getting Lessons on Water By Designing a Playground
